member.summary: Collection of all s supported by SageMakerMetrics

summary.p: The STANDARD mode provides the latest recommended default values that should be safe to run in most scenarios
Note that the default values vended from this mode might change as best practices may evolve. As a result, it is encouraged to perform tests when upgrading the SDK
The IN_REGION mode builds on the standard mode and includes optimization tailored for applications which call AWS services from within the same AWS region
Note that the default values vended from this mode might change as best practices may evolve. As a result, it is encouraged to perform tests when upgrading the SDK
The CROSS_REGION mode builds on the standard mode and includes optimization tailored for applications which call AWS services in a different region
Note that the default values vended from this mode might change as best practices may evolve. As a result, it is encouraged to perform tests when upgrading the SDK
The MOBILE mode builds on the standard mode and includes optimization tailored for mobile applications
Note that the default values vended from this mode might change as best practices may evolve. As a result, it is encouraged to perform tests when upgrading the SDK
The AUTO mode is an experimental mode that builds on the standard mode. The SDK will attempt to discover the execution environment to determine the appropriate settings automatically.

Note that the auto detection is heuristics-based and does not guarantee 100% accuracy. STANDARD mode will be used if the execution environment cannot be determined. The auto detection might query EC2 Instance Metadata service, which might introduce latency. Therefore we recommend choosing an explicit defaults_mode instead if startup latency is critical to your application
The LEGACY mode provides default settings that vary per SDK and were used prior to establishment of defaults_mode

member.name: T:Amazon.SageMakerMetrics.Internal.AmazonSageMakerMetricsEndpointProvider
member.summary: Amazon SageMakerMetrics endpoint provider. Resolves endpoint for given set of SageMakerMetricsEndpointParameters. Can throw AmazonClientException if endpoint resolution is unsuccessful.

member.name: M:Amazon.SageMakerMetrics.Internal.AmazonSageMakerMetricsEndpointProvider.ResolveEndpoint(Amazon.Runtime.Endpoints.EndpointParameters)
member.summary: Resolve endpoint for SageMakerMetricsEndpointParameters

member.name: T:Amazon.SageMakerMetrics.Internal.AmazonSageMakerMetricsEndpointResolver
member.summary: Amazon SageMakerMetrics endpoint resolver. Custom PipelineHandler responsible for resolving endpoint and setting authentication parameters for SageMakerMetrics service requests. Collects values for SageMakerMetricsEndpointParameters and then tries to resolve endpoint by calling ResolveEndpoint method on GlobalEndpoints.Provider if present, otherwise uses SageMakerMetricsEndpointProvider. Responsible for setting authentication and http headers provided by resolved endpoint.

member.name: T:Amazon.SageMakerMetrics.Model.BatchPutMetricsError
member.summary: An error that occured when putting the metric data.

member.name: P:Amazon.SageMakerMetrics.Model.BatchPutMetricsError.Code
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Code.
The error code of an error that occured when attempting to put metrics.
METRIC_LIMIT_EXCEEDED: The maximum amount of metrics per resource is exceeded.
INTERNAL_ERROR: An internal error occured.
VALIDATION_ERROR: The metric data failed validation.
CONFLICT_ERROR: Multiple requests attempted to modify the same data simultaneously.

member.name: P:Amazon.SageMakerMetrics.Model.BatchPutMetricsError.MetricIndex
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property MetricIndex.
An index that corresponds to the metric in the request.

member.name: T:Amazon.SageMakerMetrics.Model.BatchPutMetricsRequest
member.summary: Container for the parameters to the BatchPutMetrics operation. Used to ingest training metrics into SageMaker. These metrics can be visualized in SageMaker Studio and retrieved with the GetMetrics API.

member.name: P:Amazon.SageMakerMetrics.Model.BatchPutMetricsRequest.MetricData
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property MetricData.
A list of raw metric values to put.

member.name: P:Amazon.SageMakerMetrics.Model.BatchPutMetricsRequest.TrialComponentName
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property TrialComponentName.
The name of the Trial Component to associate with the metrics.

member.summary: This is the response object from the BatchPutMetrics operation.

member.name: P:Amazon.SageMakerMetrics.Model.BatchPutMetricsResponse.Errors
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Errors.
Lists any errors that occur when inserting metric data.

member.name: T:Amazon.SageMakerMetrics.AmazonSageMakerMetricsClient
member.summary:
Implementation for accessing SageMakerMetrics
Contains all data plane API operations and data types for Amazon SageMaker Metrics. Use these APIs to put and retrieve (get) features related to your training run.
BatchPutMetrics

member.name: M:Amazon.SageMakerMetrics.AmazonSageMakerMetricsClient.#ctor
member.summary:
Constructs AmazonSageMakerMetricsClient with the credentials loaded from the application's default configuration, and if unsuccessful from the Instance Profile service on an EC2 instance.
Example App.config with credentials set.
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8" ?> <configuration> <appSettings> <add key="AWSProfileName" value="AWS Default"/> </appSettings> </configuration>

member.name: M:Amazon.SageMakerMetrics.AmazonSageMakerMetricsClient.#ctor(Amazon.RegionEndpoint)
member.summary:
Constructs AmazonSageMakerMetricsClient with the credentials loaded from the application's default configuration, and if unsuccessful from the Instance Profile service on an EC2 instance.
Example App.config with credentials set.
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8" ?> <configuration> <appSettings> <add key="AWSProfileName" value="AWS Default"/> </appSettings> </configuration>

member.name: M:Amazon.SageMakerMetrics.AmazonSageMakerMetricsClient.BatchPutMetricsAsync(Amazon.SageMakerMetrics.Model.BatchPutMetricsRequest,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Used to ingest training metrics into SageMaker. These metrics can be visualized in SageMaker Studio and retrieved with the GetMetrics API.
member.param: Container for the necessary parameters to execute the BatchPutMetrics service method.
A cancellation token that can be used by other objects or threads to receive notice of cancellation.
member.returns: The response from the BatchPutMetrics service method, as returned by SageMakerMetrics.
member.seealso: REST API Reference for BatchPutMetrics Operation
